demos.prompt:
[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'SoftwareLicensingRecord', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'licenseKey': {'title': 'License Key', 'type': 'string'}, 'softwareName': {'title': 'Software Name', 'type': 'string'}, 'licenseType': {'title': 'License Type', 'type': 'string'}, 'issueDate': {'title': 'Issue Date', 'type': 'string', 'format': 'date'}, 'expirationDate': {'title': 'Expiration Date', 'type': 'string', 'format': 'date'}}, 'required': ['licenseKey', 'softwareName', 'licenseType', 'issueDate', 'expirationDate']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "As the software asset coordinator for our company, I need to document the details of a new software licensing record for our internal tracking system. We have recently acquired a software license for 'Visual Studio Enterprise' for our development team. The license key provided to us is 'VS-ENT-987654321', and it's a 'Commercial' type license. The license was issued on '2023-04-01' and it comes with an expiration date of '2024-04-01'. I require a JSON object that encapsulates these details, including the license key, software name, license type, issue date, and expiration date. Please respond with a valid JSON object that adheres to the schema provided.", 'role': 'user'}]

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'PurchaseOrder', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'orderID': {'title': 'Order ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'orderDate': {'title': 'Order Date', 'type': 'string', 'format': 'date'}, 'items': {'title': 'Items', 'type': 'array', 'items': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'productID': {'title': 'Product ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'quantity': {'title': 'Quantity', 'type': 'integer'}, 'unitPrice': {'title': 'Unit Price', 'type': 'number'}}, 'required': ['productID', 'quantity', 'unitPrice']}}, 'totalAmount': {'title': 'Total Amount', 'type': 'number'}}, 'required': ['orderID', 'orderDate', 'items', 'totalAmount']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I am currently working on the inventory management system for our trading company within the Capital Goods sector, specifically under Trading Companies & Distributors. We need to automate the generation of purchase orders. Could you please assist me by generating a JSON object for a purchase order? The purchase order should include the orderID, orderDate, a list of items with each item containing a productID, quantity, and unitPrice, and the totalAmount for the order. Here are the details for a specific order: orderID is 'PO123456', orderDate is '2023-04-15', and the items list includes two items. The first item has a productID of 'PRD001', a quantity of 10, and a unitPrice of 29.99. The second item has a productID of 'PRD002', a quantity of 5, and a unitPrice of 49.99. The totalAmount for this order is 549.85. Please respond with a valid JSON object.", 'role': 'user'}]

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'HardwareInventoryItem', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'itemID': {'title': 'Item ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'itemName': {'title': 'Item Name', 'type': 'string'}, 'itemCategory': {'title': 'Item Category', 'type': 'string'}, 'quantity': {'title': 'Quantity', 'type': 'integer'}, 'supplier': {'title': 'Supplier', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['itemID', 'itemName', 'itemCategory', 'quantity', 'supplier']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I am in charge of managing the inventory for our company's IT department, and I need to update our records with the latest hardware acquisitions. We recently purchased several high-capacity SSDs for our data center. Specifically, we acquired 20 units of the Samsung 860 EVO 2TB SATA III SSDs, with the itemID SSD860EVO-2TB. These are intended for use in our server farm to enhance data retrieval speeds and overall storage capacity. The supplier for these SSDs is TechSource Distributors. I require a JSON object that encapsulates these details for our inventory management system. The item category for these SSDs is 'Storage Devices'. Please respond with a valid JSON object that includes the itemID, itemName, itemCategory, quantity, and supplier.", 'role': 'user'}]
demos.completion: {"itemID": "SSD860EVO-2TB", "itemName": "Samsung 860 EVO 2TB SATA III SSD", "itemCategory": "Storage Devices", "quantity": 20, "supplier": "TechSource Distributors"}

demos.prompt:
[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'type': 'object', 'properties': {'BudgetManagement': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'monthly_income': {'type': 'number'}, 'expenses': {'type': 'array', 'items': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'category': {'type': 'string'}, 'amount': {'type': 'number'}}, 'required': ['category', 'amount']}}, 'savings_goal': {'type': 'number'}}, 'required': ['monthly_income', 'expenses', 'savings_goal']}}}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': 'I need to create a monthly budget plan. My monthly income is $4500. Here are my expenses: Rent is $1200, groceries are $600, utilities are $300, transportation is $250, and insurance is $150. I also want to set aside $500 for savings. Could you assist me by generating a JSON object that represents my monthly budget plan?', 'role': 'user'}]

predictor.signature_instructions:
```json
{
  "prefix": "To construct a structured JSON object, start by identifying the main elements and key-value pairs in the text.",
  "extract_information": "Parse the given text for critical data points, categorizing them into appropriate keys like 'name', 'age', 'occupation', etc. In cases where information is unstructured, deduce meaningful tags to organize it within your JSON structure.",
  "validate_data": "Ensure all values adhere to their expected formats (e.g., alphanumeric for names, numerical for ages). Disregard extraneous content that does not contribute to the main objective of data representation.",
  "create_json_object": "Compose a valid JSON object encapsulating all relevant information in key-value pairs as cleanly as possible while avoiding unnecessary whitespace or newline characters.",
}
```
predictor.signature_prefix:
THIS IS AN EXAMPLE SCHEMA:
```json
{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "flightNumber": {"type": "string"},
    "departureAirport": {"type": "string"},
    "arrivalAirport": {"type": "string"},
    "flightDuration": {"type": "string"}
  },
  "required": ["flightNumber", "departureAirport", "arrivalAirport"]
}
```
THIS IS AN EXAMPLE COMPLETION:
```json
{
  "flightNumber": "AF113",
  "departureAirport": "Charles de Gaulle Airport (CDG)",
  "arrivalAirport": "John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK)",
  "flightDuration": "8 hours and 30 minutes"
}
```
